Filtering module¶

Filtering.contrast_hist(file_name, img)¶

Plots histogram after contrast stretching

Parameters:
  • img – Image array
  • file_name – name user wants to save image as
Filtering.contrast_stretching(file_name, img)¶

Adjusts contrast in image.

Parameters:image – jpeg of image
Returns:Image array after contrast stretching
Filtering.equalization_hist(file_name, img)¶

Saves equalized histogram

Parameters:
  • img – Image array
  • file_name – name the user wnats to save image as
Filtering.hist(file_name, img)¶

Adjusts image intensities to enhance contrast.

Parem file_name:
 file name of the image as used to save the image.
Parameters:img – jpeg of image
Returns:Image array after histogram equalization
Filtering.log_compression(file_name, img)¶

Replace pixel value with its logarithm (effectively enhancing low intensity pixel values).

Parameters:
  • file_name – file name of the image as used to save the image.
  • img – the jpeg image.
Returns:

output image (in .jpg)
Filtering.log_hist(file_name, img)¶

Plots histogram after contrast stretching

Parameters:
  • img – Image array
  • file_name – name user wants to save image as
Filtering.raw_hist(file_name, img)¶

Plots raw histogram

Parameters:
  • img – Image array
  • file_name – name of file user wants to save as
Filtering.rev_hist(file_name, img)¶

Plots histogram after contrast stretching

Parameters:
  • img – Image array
  • file_name – name user wants to save image as
Filtering.reverse_video(file_name, img)¶

Transforms image to its negative

Parameters:
  • file_name – file name of the image as used to save the image.
  • img – the jpeg image
Returns:

.jpg image
Filtering.strip_header(base64_str)¶

Strips the data url header

Parameters:base64_str – Raw base64 string
Returns:Stripped string
